newsitem.title: UK: WHITBREAD GAINS ON FOLLOW THROUGH BUYING.
newsitem.headline: WHITBREAD GAINS ON FOLLOW THROUGH BUYING.

text.p: Shares Whitbread Plc rose nearly two percent on Wednesday, boosted by follow through buying from Tuesday's rally amid views the stock is undervalued in the brewing sector, traders and analysts said.
By 1029 GMT, Whitbread shares were up 14p at 845-1/2p, after gaining 10-1/2p on Tuesday.
Other brewing shares were mixed. Bass Plc fell 4-1/2p to 843p and Scottish and Newcastle Plc rose 4p to 752-1/2p.
"Whitbread has been undervalued against the brewers for some time and people have woken up to the value in their shares," said an analyst at Panmure Gordon.
Panmure is a buyer of the stock with a price target of 900p, he said.
"It's just a continuation from the positive consumer news for Whitbread's restaurants and pub interests," said Nick Lyall, brewers and spirits analyst at SocGen.
